comments.body: This is not a static method which is inconsistent with line 45, `the static magic method approach`. I guess one of them should be changed for consistency.
Oops missed this one. Will fix.
Since this is a resolution section, it would be great to mention about what is our design for type casting or coercion.
Yes I plan to add it in a separate PR, when we do support type coercion.

comments.body: According to the description, it's clear that magic method takes higher precedence than `produceResult`. Then, what about the relation between `public static int invoke` and `public int invoke` (if the user class has both of them accidentally)? If there is no description yet, shall we add some here?
Java doesn't allow both `static int invoke` and `int invoke` with the same parameters.

diffHunk:
